docs.lead_paragraph: Ernest Gottscho, who retired in 1969 as a librarian and translator for the Geological Survey of the United States Department of the Interior in Washington, died Monday in the Holly Manor Nursing Home, Mendham N.J. He was 81 years old and lived in Mandham.

headline.main: Ernest Gottscho, 81, Who Served As Geological Survey Translator

docs.snippet: Richard Hugo, director of the creative-writing program at the University of Montana, and author of four books of poetry, will succeed Stanley Kunitz as judge of the Yale Younger Poets Series, it was announced by Chester Kerr, director of the Yale ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Richard Hugo, director of the creative-writing program at the University of Montana, and author of four books of poetry, will succeed Stanley Kunitz as judge of the Yale Younger Poets Series, it was announced by Chester Kerr, director of the Yale University Press, which sponsors the series. Previous judges have included Archibald MacLeish, W. H. Auden and Dudley Fitts.
docs.abstract: Richard Hugo will succeed Stanley Kunitz as judge of Yale Younger Poets Series (S)

headline.main: Richard Hugo Named As Yale Poetry Judge

docs.lead_paragraph: As one young Manhattan couple in a small apartment agreed half-jokingly the other day, living in the city may be the most effective birth control method of all. "Having a baby means needing more space," said the wife, "which means we can't have a baby."
